content.title: Swahid Kushal Konwar Sarbajanin Briddha Pension Achoni
content.department: Dept. of Panchayat & Rural Development, Govt. of Assam
content.details: Launched on 2nd October 2018 by the Hon'ble Chief Minister of Assam, the scheme 'Swahid Kushal Konwar Sarbajanin Briddha Pension Achoni' is a Pension Scheme by the Dept. of Panchayat & Rural Development, Govt. of Assam. The objective of the scheme is to streamline the payment of old-age pensions and funds. The scheme is meant for the residents of the State of Assam, who are aged above 60 years. The beneficiary will be granted a sum of ₹ 250/- per month through DBT. The pension amount will be remitted on the first day of every month to the account of the beneficiary. The scheme is expected to cover 15,000-20,000 people in every constituency.
benefits: The beneficiary will be granted a sum of ₹ 250/- per month through DBT.
The pension amount will be remitted on the first day of every month to the account of the beneficiary.
eligibility: The scheme is meant for the residents of the State of Assam, who are 60 years or above in age.
exclusions: Beneficiaries of any of the existing government schemes.
Parents of children (where the latter is employed with the government).
Any taxpayer who earns an income of above ₹ 2,50,000/-.
content.application_process: Offline. Step 1: Visit the Gaon Panchayat/Development Block/ Municipal Corporation/Municipal Board/Town Committee of the respective jurisdiction. Request for a print of the Application Format for 'Swahid Kushal Konwar Sarbajanin Briddha Pension Achoni'. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory details, and attach the self-attested documents. The following details shall be needed: Name of the Applicant, Name of the Applicant’s Father/Mother/Husband/Wife, Gender of the Applicant, Date of Birth of the Applicant, Category of Caste (ST/SC/OBC/Others), Details of Address, Details of the Bank Account, Mobile Number of the Applicant. NOTE: The application must be supported with the signature or thumb impression of the concerned applicant. Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form, along with the required documents, to your nearest Gaon Panchayat/Development Block/ Municipal Corporation/Municipal Board/Town Committee of the respective jurisdiction. Upon submission of the application, the beneficiary will start receiving the pension amounts if the particulars mentioned in the form are accurate and applies to the context.
documents_required: Proof of Age / Date of Birth
Domicile/Residential Certificate of the state of Assam
Details of the Aadhaar Linked Bank Account

faqs.question: When Was The 'Swahid Kushal Konwar Sarbajanin Briddha Pension Achoni' Scheme Launched?
faqs.answer: The 'Swahid Kushal Konwar Sarbajanin Briddha Pension Achoni' Scheme was launched on 2nd October 2018, the 149th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi.

faqs.question: Who Launched The 'Swahid Kushal Konwar Sarbajanin Briddha Pension Achoni' Scheme?
faqs.answer: The 'Swahid Kushal Konwar Sarbajanin Briddha Pension Achoni' Scheme was launched by the (then) Chief Minister of Assam Shri Sarbananda Sonowal.

faqs.question: Who Was Swahid Kushal Konwar?
faqs.answer: Swahid Kushal Konwar was a freedom fighter.

faqs.question: Which Department Manages This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is managed by the Dept. of Panchayat & Rural Development, Govt. of Assam.

faqs.question: What Are The Objectives Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to streamline the payment of old-age pensions and funds.

faqs.question: What Is The Amount Of Pension That One Can Receive Through This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary will be granted a sum of ₹ 250/- per month.

faqs.question: How Will The Amount Of The Pension Be Deposited Into The Bank Account Of The Beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The amount of the pension is deposited into the bank account of the beneficiary through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

faqs.question: What Is The Age Criteria For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is meant for the residents of the State of Assam, who are 60 years or above in age.

faqs.question: How Many Beneficiaries Does This Scheme Expect To Reach?
faqs.answer: The scheme is expected to cover 15,000-20,000 people in every constituency.

faqs.question: How Many Constituencies Are There In The State Of Assam?
faqs.answer: There are 126 constituencies in the state of Assam.

faqs.question: Is It Mandatory For The Applicant To Be Retired In Order To Be Eligible For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there are no such criteria for this scheme.

faqs.question: When Will The Amount Of The Pension Be Deposited In The Bank Account Of The Beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The pension amount will be remitted on the first day of every month to the account of the beneficiary.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Link To The Scheme Guidelines?
faqs.answer: The scheme guidelines can be found at this link - https://assam.gov.in/scheme-page/526.

faqs.question: What Are The Mandatory Fields In The Application Form?
faqs.answer: The mandatory fields in the Application Form are - Name of the applicant, Name of the applicant’s Father/Mother/Husband/Wife, Gender of the applicant, Date of Birth of the applicant, Category of Caste (ST/SC/OBC/Others), Details of address, Details of the bank account, Mobile number of the applicant.

faqs.question: From Where Can I Get The Hard Copy Of The Application Form?
faqs.answer: You can get the same from your nearest Gaon Panchayat/Development Block/ Municipal Corporation/Municipal Board/Town Committee of the respective jurisdiction.
